title: Volcano guides protest new rules on Mt Etna | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Tour guides on Italy's Mount Etna are protesting new restrictions brought in after a recent string of volcanic eruptions in the area. They say the rules are excessive and could have ongoing impacts on tourism. Rebecca Johnston reports. title: Crowds tear-gassed and lawsuit filed over Minneapolis ICE crackdown | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Thousands of federal agents have descended on Minnesota and Illinois, prompting both states to sue Donald Trump's government to end the crackdown. Meanwhile around the country, protesters have clashed with officers attempting to make more arrests. Angus Mackintosh reports for The World. title: Le Pen returns to court to appeal conviction and challenge election ban | ABC NEWS
description: Marine Le Pen’s high-stakes appeal proceedings have begun in Paris as the far-right politician seeks to clear her name and fight for her political survival.  Le Pen was slapped with a five-year ban from running for office after she and other senior National Rally figures were found guilty of embezzling 7 million dollars of EU funds to fund their party’s expenses. Marine Le Pen’s prospects of running for president in 2027 hinge on the outcome of this appeal. title: Trump tells Iranian protesters 'help is on its way’ | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has encouraged Iranian protesters to overthrow the country’s Islamic regime, saying ‘help is on its way’ in a social media post.  Iranian authorities have told Reuters that around 2,000 people have been killed in widespread unrest since late December.  The US leader is set to meet with his national security advisors including Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.  ABC correspondent Ben Knight says cyber attacks, kinetic strikes and more sanctions are some of the available options for the White House. title: Deported Melbourne tobacco kingpin Kazem Hamad arrested in Iraq | ABC NEWS
description: Kazem Hamad has been arrested in Iraq for alleged drug importation and smuggling, reportedly at the request of the Australian government. Convicted drug trafficker Kazem Hamad — also known as Kadhim Malik Hamad Rabah al-Hajami — was one of the key players in Melbourne's tobacco wars. He was deported from Australia in 2023. title: The boycott that killed Adelaide Writers’ Week | ABC News Daily podcast
description: This year’s Adelaide Writers’ Week has been cancelled following a debacle that involved a boycott by more than 180 participants, board members quitting and the event’s director stepping down.    There was outrage about the board’s decision to remove Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah from the rundown citing cultural sensitivities in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.    Today, Denis Muller from the Centre for Advancing Journalism at Melbourne Uni on the damage done and what it means for free speech.       Featured:    Denis Muller, Senior Research Fellow at the Centre for Advancing Journalism at the University of Melbourne and co-host of the Truth, Lies and Media podcast

title: Uncle of student killed in Iran protests describes harrowing and shocking scenes | ABC NEWS
description: The family of a young Iranian fashion student killed during anti-regime protests have spoken of harrowing scenes in Tehran. Rubina Aminian's uncle describes that many young people are being killed in the crackdown and they have been shot in the 'head, neck and face.' At least 2,000 protesters have reportedly been killed and an internet blackout is complicating efforts to get information about the situation on the ground. title: David Crisafulli critical of BOM amid Queensland floods | ABC NEWS
description: The town of Clermont in Central Queensland has received over 230mm of rain in the last 48 hours from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji. Dozens of homes have been impacted and many roads are under water.  Meanwhile, Queensland Premier David Crisafulli says there has not been 'adequate investment' the Bureau of Meteorology's rain gauges, river monitoring systems and weather radars to help warn residents and authorities. title: Fake business accused of exploiting Bondi attack to 'profit from grief' | ABC NEWS
description: NSW authorities have launched an investigation into an online retailer for allegedly profiting off the Bondi terror attack.  The website, which posted an AI-generated image of a fictional couple called Isla and James, claimed it was closing down after one of its co-owners was shot during the Bondi Beach terror attack.  The state’s Fair Trading Commissioner Natasha Mann is accusing the website of 'profiteering from grief' and labelled their trading activity as 'unconscionable conduct'.   The website is now inactive as authorities urge consumers to beware of online fraud in the wake of tragedies and report any suspicious sites to Scamwatch. description: Queensland premier David Crisafulli is warning that flood-hit areas of central and north west Queensland could receive more rain over the next few days. title: Tom Silvagni seeks to overturn rape convictions | ABC NEWS
description: Convicted rapist Tom Silvagni has filed an application for leave to appeal his criminal conviction at the Victorian Court of Appeal.  The son of AFL legend Stephen Silvagni and TV personality Jo Silvagni was sentenced to six years and two months in jail after being found guilty of raping a woman while pretending to be her partner after a night out in 2024. The County Court of Victoria heard evidence he falsified a Uber receipt to support his alibi. title: Bill and Hillary Clinton refuse to comply with congress over Epstein investigation | ABC NEWS
description: Former US President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton say they will not comply with a US House subpoena issued for them to testify at an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. In a statement, the pair accused the Republican head of the US House Oversight Committee of overseeing a process "literally designed to result in our imprisonment". title: What kind of 'help' will Trump offer Iranian protesters? | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has encouraged Iranian protesters to continue demonstrating and oust the Islamic regime, saying ‘help is on its way’.  The US leader made the call in a social media post after weeks of unrest in the Middle Eastern country, with at least 2,000 protesters killed in clashes with Iranian authorities.  Former negotiator Aaron David Miller says the US president has ‘boxed’ himself into a tricky situation.
